definition: to remove utterly from recognition or memory
examples: … a successful love crowned all other successes and obliterated all other failures.

definition: to remove from existence : destroy utterly all trace, indication, or significance of
examples: The tide eventually obliterated all evidence of our sandcastles.

definition: to cause (something, such as a bodily part, a scar, or a duct conveying body fluid) to disappear or collapse : remove sense 4
examples: a blood vessel obliterated by inflammation

definition: to make undecipherable or imperceptible by obscuring or wearing away
examples: A dimness like a fog envelops consciousness / As mist obliterates a crag.
